goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
indicator_name: Proportion of population with sustainable access to sanitation facilities
graph_title: Proportion of population with sustainable access to sanitation facilities
goal_name: 6.Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
target_name: 6.2 By 2030, achieve access to adequate and equitable sanitation and hygiene for all and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations
indicator_name1: 6.2.1.1 Proportion of population with sustainable access to sanitation facilities
organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Department of Household Statistics)
definitions: The proportion of the population using safety-based sanitation services is measured as the proportion of the population that uses improved sanitation services at the household level and does not share them with other households, and excrement is safely disposed of through wastewater disposal systems.
concepts: Improved sanitation facilities include: flush toilets connected to drainage systems (sewerage
rationale_interpretation: Safe handling of faecal waste contributes to improving human health indicators, since the release of untreated wastewater into the environment poses a threat to public health.
data_sources: Integrated Sample Survey of household budgets and the Labor Force (hereinafter referred to as IODH).
data_collection: The survey of the population is conducted by interviewers through direct visits to households and filling out IODH questionnaires approved by the Resolution of the National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic.             IODH surveys use personal interviews using tablet computers (ComputerAssisted Personal Interview, CAPI).Data on household housing conditions is collected on an annual basis, and the indicator is developed based on the results of the year.
computation_methods: The population of households living in residential buildings connected to sanitation systems, using improved sanitation facilities only by members of their household, as a percentage of the total population.
comments_limitations: The indicator has been developed since 2000 in order to monitor the coverage of the population by centralized sanitation systems.
quality_assurance: The raw data is checked for quality before it is used for further analysis.
data_availability_gaps: A comparable dynamic range calculated using a single methodology has been available since 2000.
international_comparability: Changes to the survey questionnaires are required to develop an indicator consistent with the methodology of the global indicator.
references_documentation: The National SDG Reporting Platform of the Kyrgyz Republic: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan .github.io
